ourvideopoker

Class DoubleBonus10_7

  • java.lang.Object
    • ourvideopoker.DoubleBonus10_7
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VideoPokerVariation

    public class DoubleBonus10_7
extends java.lang.Object
implements VideoPokerVariation
    Class that implements the VideoPokerVariation Interface with the DoubleBonus 10_7 variation of a videopoker game.
    Author:
    Alexandre, Rui , Pedro
    See Also:
    VideoPokerVariation

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) CardAnalizer analizer
      This variation is equipped with a object for analyze handcards and give a framework of methods to give advices for the player.
      (package private) java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> PayoutMap
      This object is a private hashmap that represents the payout table for this variation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DoubleBonus10_7()
      Constructor of the DoubleBonus10_7 variation, it only initializes the payout hashmap

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean[] evaluateHandAdvice(HandCards hand)
      This method gives advices of cards that a player have to hold for the DoubleBonus variation of the VideoPoker based on a given hand

      Method that returns the name of the hand in this varitation given a hand
      int getPayout(HandCards hand, int bet)
      Method that takes a hand of cards and the bet that the player have placed and returns the respective payout

      • evaluateHandAdvice

        public boolean[] evaluateHandAdvice(HandCards hand)
        This method gives advices of cards that a player have to hold for the DoubleBonus variation of the VideoPoker based on a given hand
        Specified by:
        evaluateHandAdvice in interface VideoPokerVariation
        Parameters:
        hand - it receives a HandCards object with a hand of cards to be evaluated
        Returns:
        it returns a fixed 5 size boolean array that is true in the index's of the hand the player have to hold and false in the index's that are not to hold
